summary: This is an email chain between FBI and US Attorney's Office personnel regarding investigative steps taken concerning Mark Epstein. It discusses subpoena requests for phone numbers and email accounts, including emergency disclosure requests to service providers.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: The email discusses investigative steps regarding Mark Epstein, including subpoena requests for his phone numbers and email accounts.

persons.name: Jose
persons.context: An FBI agent who sent an initial email about Mark Epstein and is coordinating investigative steps with the US Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Jose, an FBI agent, is investigating Mark Epstein and coordinating subpoena requests for his communications data.

events.title: Investigation coordination for Mark Epstein
events.description: FBI and US Attorney's Office personnel exchange emails regarding investigative steps, including emergency disclosure requests to SignalWire and Fastmail for subscriber and IP logs related to Mark Epstein's phone numbers and email.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively investigating Mark Epstein as of May 2020, coordinating with the US Attorney's Office.
Investigators identified phone numbers linked to Mark Epstein that came back to VoIP lines, complicating subpoena targeting.
Emergency disclosure requests were sent to legal@signalwire.com for subscriber and IP logs for the phone numbers.
Emails associated with Mark Epstein were found to originate from fastmail.com, an Australian-based company, prompting another emergency disclosure request.
A simple Google search revealed Mark Epstein's email address and phone number, indicating they were publicly accessible.
